sentences: Öine taevas, millele on iseloomulikud mingid kindlad tähtkujud.
Loodusvaatleja jälgib öise taevapildi muutumist ja märkab erinevaid mingid mustreid.
Mingid väikesed pilved hõljuvasid taeva all.
context: The word 'mingid' is the plural partitive form of the Estonian pronoun/morpheme 'mingi'. In this context, it functions as an indefinite determiner similar to English 'certain', 'some', or 'particular'. It's used to indicate that we're referring to specific but not explicitly named items. The dictionary definition shows it being used in astronomical contexts to describe certain characteristic features of the night sky.
